intro: Galium nephrostigmaticum, commonly known as the kidney-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that often have a kidney-shaped appearance. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium nephrostigmaticum is a herbaceous perennial that spreads via rhizomes, forming dense mats in its native habitat.
